titles.title: Mäṣḥafä gǝnzät “Book of the Funeral Ritual” / Mäṣḥafä ʾardǝʾǝt “Book of the Disciples”

shortcontents.shortcontent:
I) Mäṣḥafä gǝnzät “Book of the Funeral Ritual” (fols. 3ra-127vb) - Discourse of St. Athanasius on death (fols. 3ra-13ra) - Mäṣḥaf zä-wäḍʾat ʾǝm-ʾIyärusalem “Book that came from Jerusalem” (fols. 13va-21ra) - Homily by ʾabba Sälama, Metropolitan of Ethiopia (fols. 90rb-93rb) - Antiphons (ʾaryam, mäwaśǝʾt and mǝlṭan) (fols. 122vb-127vb) II) Mäṣḥafä ʾardǝʾǝt “Book of the Disciples” (fols. 128ra-149rb)
Colophon.

copyists.copyist: Wäldä Śǝllase is mentioned as the scribe only for Text II in fol. 128vb and the colophon.

donors.donor: The names Ḫadära Mikaʾel and Wälättä Mikaʾel are written in Text I over erasure in fols. 40va, 43vb, 44ra.

owners.owner: Ṣǝge Dǝngǝl, together with his wife Wälättä Giyorgis, is mentioned as the commissioner of Text II (e.g., fols. 128vb, 139va, 149ra).

dcomments.dcomment: Quires XVI-XIX are of more recent time, dating probably to the 19th cent.

txstates.txstate: The Ms. is worn. The back board is missing. The sewing has been repaired. Many fols. are stained with wax and dirt. The codex is affected by water and humidity (esp. fols.128-149).

bindings.binding: Two wooden boards (the back board is missing). Two pairs of sewing stations.

bnothers.bnother: Two rows of small holes visible on the spinefolds of the quires, one close to the head and one close to the tail of the Ms.

squires.squire:
A(2; s.l.: 1, stub after stub of 2; 2, stub after 2/fols. 1r-2v) – I(8/fols. 3r-10v) – II(8/fols. 11r-18v) – III(8/fols. 19r-26v) – IV(8/fols. 27r-34v) – V(8; s.l.: 3, stub after 6; 6, stub after 3/fols. 35r-42v) – VI(8/fols. 43r-50v) – VII(8/fols. 51r-58v) – VIII(8/fols. 59r-66v) – IX(8/fols. 67r-74v) – X(8/fols. 75r-82v) – XI(8/fols. 83r-90v) – XII(8/fols. 91r-98v) – XIII(8/fols. 99r-106v) – XIV(10; s.l.: 3, stub after 7; 8, stub after 2/fols. 107r-116v) – XV(10; s.l.: 3, stub after 7; 8, stub after 2/fols. 117r-126v) – ˂XVI(7; s.l.: 1, stub after 7/fols. 127r-133v) – XVII(6/fols. 134r-139v) – XVIII(6/fols. 140r-145v) – XIX(4/fols. 146r-149v)˃.
Quires XVI – XIX were probably added later.

taunit.mr-info: For Text I, all data for fol. 4r.
taunit.rl-info: Pricking and ruling are visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A-1A1A/0-0/0-0/C. Primary pricks are visible. Ruling pricks are visible. The upper line is written above the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling.

margin.info: For Text I, all data for fol. 4r.
For Text II, all data for fol. 129r.

rulings.ruling: Pricking and ruling are visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A-1A1A/0-0/0-0/C. Primary pricks are visible. Ruling pricks are visible. The upper line is written above the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling.

ptypeofscripts.ptypeofscript: Hand a: 18th century(?) Hand b: 19th century(?)

phandwritings.phandwriting: Hand a: fine, slightly irregular. Hand b: mediocre.

pchangeofhands.pchangeofhand: Hand a: fols. 3ra-127vb; the quality of handwriting changes (e.g., fol. 114r). Hand b (Wäldä Śǝllase): fols. 128ra-149rb; the handwriting appears uneven with broadly spaced and right-sloping letters. The scribe sometimes disregards the ruling line (e.g., 146v).

rubrications.rubrication: Nomina sacra; names of the donors in Text I; names of the commissioner and the scribe in Text II; a few lines in the incipit pages of Text I and II, alternating with black lines; two initial lines of each section of the text Text I and II; some abbreviations, elements of the punctuation signs; elements of Ethiopic numbers; some other words, e.g., ṣällǝyu (e.g., fols. 10va, 11rb, 15ra), tägśaṣ (fol. 22rb), sälam (fols. 80va, 125ra), wä-ʾǝmzǝ (e.g., fols. 83vb, 84rb, 86rb), mǝlṭan (e.g., fols. 125ra, 126ra, 127ra).

abbreviations.abbreviation: ይ፡ ሕ፡ for ይበል፡ ሕዝብ፡ (e.g., fols. 16ra, 18vb, 20va) ይ፡ ዲ፡ for ይበል፡ ዲያቆን፡ (e.g., fols. 40ra, 43va, 70va) ይ፡ ካ፡ for ይበል፡ ካሕን፡ (e.g., fols. 43vb, 44ra, 53vb) ፍ፡ for ፍቱሐ፡ (e.g., fols. 38vb, 39ra) አ for አሜን (e.g., fols. 110ra, 111rb, 112rb)

colophon.tran: Fol. 149rb: May praise be to God who made me finish the writing of the Book of the 12 Disciples. I am sinner and wicked Wäldä Śəllase.
colophon.det: The colophon mentions Wäldä Śǝllase as the scribe only for Text I.

extras.extra: - The name Gäräziḥar is written on the inner side of the front board in red pen. - A note written in blue and red pen, mentioning haläqa Bärihu, Bǝsrat Gäräziḥar and Gäräziḥar in fol. 1r. - Crude drawing of three figures in fol. 1v. - Corrections written interlineally: fols. 22vb, 23vb, 25va, 27ra, 33rb, 37rb, 46ra, 54va, 64va, 67ra, 71ra, 76rb, 76va, 85ra, 112vb, 115ra, 117rb, 122ra, 133vb, 136ra. - Corrections written over erasures: fol. 43a. - Erasures: fols. 56ra, 110vb, 147ra. - Space for rubricated names left unfilled in supplication formulas: fols. 44ra, 48rb, 56vb, 57rb, 57va, 58ra, 60va, 61rb, 61vb. - Minor notes and writing exercises in the margins: fols. 77v, 88v, 149v. - A note mentioning Mäzgäbe Śǝlasse and “its scribe (?)” Gäbrä Ṣadǝq in fol. 149rb.

frames.frame: Fol. 128ra (incipit of Text 2): simple coloured (red and black) ornamental band; interlaces.
